title: What is the last date for filing income tax returns?
desc: The deadline varies each year. Typically, itâ€™s July 31 for individuals and October 31 for businesses.

title: What documents are required for filing taxes?
desc: PAN, Aadhaar, Form 16, investment proofs, bank statements, and salary slips are commonly required.

title: Can I file my taxes without Form 16?
desc: Yes, you can file taxes by calculating your income and deductions manually.

title: What happens if I miss the tax filing deadline?
desc: You may face penalties, interest on unpaid taxes, and restrictions on certain financial activities.

title: Can I revise my income tax return after submission?
desc: Yes, revised returns can be filed before the end of the assessment year.

title: How do I claim deductions under Section 80C?
desc: You need to provide proof of eligible investments like PPF, ELSS, and others.

title: Can I file taxes online myself?
desc: Yes, the Income Tax Department provides an e-filing portal, but professional help ensures accuracy.

title: What is the penalty for incorrect tax filing?
desc: The penalty depends on the severity of the error and the tax laws applicable.

title: Do I need to file taxes if my income is below the taxable limit?
desc: Filing is not mandatory, but it is advisable for maintaining financial records.

title: How do I know my refund status?
desc: Refund status can be checked on the Income Tax Department's e-filing portal.

title: Is tax filing mandatory for freelancers and consultants?
desc: Yes, freelancers and consultants with taxable income must file returns.

title: What is the process for filing taxes for a deceased individual?
desc: Legal heirs can file the returns on behalf of the deceased.

title: Can I carry forward losses incurred in previous years?
desc: Yes, business or capital losses can be carried forward to future years.

title: What are the benefits of filing taxes on time?
desc: Avoid penalties, get faster refunds, and maintain financial credibility.

title: How do I file a rectification request for my tax return?
desc: Rectification requests can be filed through the e-filing portal under the 'My Account' section.
